The claim of 28 million mail: in ballots going "missing" was based on data compiled by the U.S. Election Assistance Commission (EAC) and reported by the Public Interest Legal Foundation (PILF), as mentioned in the RealClearPolitics article.
The expert: s verdict also mentions that the figure of 28 million missing ballots is likely even higher, as some areas, such as Chicago, did not respond to the survey questions conducted by the EAC. Additionally, the figure does not include spoiled, undeliverable, or otherwise unaccounted-for ballots.
